structure.unit: ESCAPE AND OTHER OFFENSES RELATING TO CUSTODY

law.catch_line: Promoting contraband in the second degree.

text.section:
A person is guilty of promoting contraband in the second degree when:
He knowingly introduces contraband into a detention facility or a penitentiary; or
Being a person confined in a detention facility or a penitentiary, he knowingly makes, obtains, or possesses contraband.
Promoting contraband in the second degree is a Class A misdemeanor.

law.history: Amended 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 497, sec. 25, effective July 13, 1990. -- Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 174, effective January 1, 1975.
